children.subject:
For 61a I think 8ish hours is a good number if the material clicks for you, but could be higher if it doesn't.

70 varies widely from person to person. Some people take 3 hours, some people take 20. Depends on how quickly you can pick up the concepts.
How many hours per week for each 61A and 70 are normal for students who might take it first year?

I need a minimum B+ in cs70, 61A,61B to declare my major , I want to aim for the maximum so that I can at least get a B+.  What happens if I find it too hard and I drop a class in the middle of semester  , then I will be left with 9 units . Is that going to be a problem for L&S ?

You can late drop one class without penalty during your entire time at Cal; in the future you need to stay above 13 units for L&S unless you apply for a reduced courseload. I wouldn't recommend using it as a backup plan in your first semester.

Another thing to consider is that financial aid and visa status may be affected if you go below the minimum unit requirement.

I guess it's not impossible to get an A+, but keep in mind it's still extremely difficult and comes down to how you do on the exams, not just how many hours/week the classes require. CS 70's grade is almost entirely exams and in CS 61A, in order to get an A+, you would need to complete all of the assignments and still get a high score on every exam, which is quite difficult (you may feel solid on the material, but there is always the chance you have a slip during the exam or just don't feel 100% that day). 

That being said, it's more important to get a solid grasp on and enjoy the material, and that's totally achievable if you just put in the hours, even if you get an A or an A- (coming into college and expecting A+'s is a bit unrealistic, as many find out eventually their first semester--for reference, I also took community college courses on top of my high school courses, had a job, and got all A's, but then came to Berkeley and realized that these classes still proved much more challenging than all of that).

Also, don't feel like you should miss out on the opportunity to explore other courses in other departments here just because you want A+'s in a couple of your major classes. You should consider this, even if it means giving up an A+ for an A (which makes no difference to your GPA, if it matters).

history.content:
Hi guys ,

             Has anyone taken these two classes together or know someone who has. I am on waitlist for EE16A (and dont plan to take even if i get in) . So i have pretty much decided that i am taking these two and one P/NP American cultures class.

I want am A + in both . i have programming experience( upto data structures in cc )  and i am good at math ( i like proofs and cc prof focused on logic based proof). I am wiling to work hard . This will be my first semester. So is it ok . In my community college i worked 40 hours and took math 3 , 6 , cs21 in one semester and got A in all . I wont work at berkeley (maybe 10 hours) . So how is the workload ? How many hours in a week do i have to study to succeed in these two classes.

          Thank a Lot!!!
